author: Liam Corless
title: Manchester City want over £20million for Joe Hart - and 'goalkeeper WILL be allowed to join top-six rival'
text:
Joe Hart is expected to leave Manchester City in the summer (Photo: AFP/Getty) Share Get Liverpool FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Manchester City are willing to sell goalkeeper Joe Hart to a top-six rival, according to reports. 
The Times say City are seeking more than £20million for the England star, who is spending this season on loan at Torino. 
City reportedly have no qualms with letting Hart join a Premier League rival, which could encourage Liverpool to swoop for him in the summer. 
They are yet to settle on a No 1 out of Simon Mignolet and Loris Karius, both of whom have made high-profile errors this season. Joe Hart is spending the season on loan at Torino (Photo: Marco Luzzani) Simon Mignolet and Loris Karius are yet to convince between the sticks for Liverpool (Photo: Liverpool FC/Getty Images) 
Pep Guardiola shipped Hart out at the start of the season and brought in Claudio Bravo as his replacement. 
But the £17.1million signing from Barcelona has struggled massively in England and recently lost his place in City's starting XI to Willy Caballero. 
However, despite Bravo's troubles Guardiola is unlikely to reinstate Hart as City's No 1 upon the expiration of his Torino loan spell. Read More
